# tokenField(_:styleForRepresentedObject:)

**Instance Method**

Allows the delegate to return the token style for editing the specified represented object.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor optional func tokenField(_ tokenField: NSTokenField, styleForRepresentedObject representedObject: Any) -> NSTokenField.TokenStyle
```

## Parameters

- **tokenField**: The token field that sent the message.
- **representedObject**: A represented object of the token field.

## Return Value

The style that should be used to display the representedObject. Possible values are shown in NSTokenStyle Values.

## Discussion

If the delegate implements this method and returns an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTokenField/TokenStyle-swift.enum] that differs from the style set by [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTokenField/tokenStyle-swift.property], the value the delegate returns is preferred.

If the delegate does not implement this method, the token field’s [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTokenField/tokenStyle-swift.property] is used.

## Displaying Tokenized Strings

- **tokenField(_:displayStringForRepresentedObject:)**: Allows the delegate to provide a string to be displayed as a proxy for the given represented object.
